chapter.title: Exercise: Using a connector to send an email

section.title: Goal
section.para: The goal of this exercise is to demonstrate an interaction between Bonita BPM and an external system with the use of a connector. In this context, we will notify the leave request initiator about his request's status with an email connector.

section.title: Instructions overview
section.para: Duplicate the process diagram from the previous exercise to create a 6.0 version.
Add an email connector on the "Notify request approved" and "Notify request rejected" service tasks. These will send an email to the requestor with the request's validation status.
The following code will be used to retrieve the requestor's email in the connector:

para.emphasis: Duplicate the process diagram from the previous exercise to create a 6.0 version.
Test the email connector to obtain the right SMTP configuration.

listitem.para: Navigate to the "Development / Connectors / Test connector" top menu.
Select the "Email (SMTP)" connector by using either the text filter or the "Messaging" category and click on "Next".
Fill the connection parameters based on your email approvedount settings and click on "Next".
Enter your email in the "From" and "To" fields and click on "Next".
Enter "Bonita test" as the subject, click on the "Test" button and confirm the test without checking any dependency.
At this stage, you should get a message similar to this one:
Make sure that you receive the email (this may take a couple of minutes). If you do not receive it, update the connector configuration and re-test it.
Once the configuration is valid, click on .
Name the configuration "emailConfig" and save it.
Close the connector test interface.

para.emphasis: Add an email connector on the "Notify request approved" task.

listitem.para: Select the task, navigate to the "General / Connectors" tab and click on "Add".
Select the "Email (SMTP)" connector.
Name it "sendRequestApprovedEmail" and click on "Next".
Do not fill in the parameters but click on .
Select the "emailConfig" and move to the "Email addressee" configuration page.
Enter your email address in the "From" field.
Use the "pencil" icon to edit the expression of the "To" field.
Set the "Expression type" to "Script", name the script "getRequestorEmail" and paste the following in the code edition zone:
Move to the next page and set "Leave request approved" as the subject.
Click on "Finish".

para.emphasis: Add an email connector on the "Notify request rejected" task.

listitem.para: Repeat the previous steps by naming the connector "sendRequestRejectedEmail" and setting "Leave request rejected" as the subject.

para.emphasis: Update the email of the test user "Walter Bates".

listitem.para: Open the Portal from the Studio by using the button from the toolbar.
Switch to the "Administrator" profile then navigate to the "Organization / Users" menu.
Select the user "Walter Bates" and click on the "More" button.
Click on "Edit user".
Select the "Business card" tab
Enter your email in the "Email" field.
Save your changes and close the Portal.

para.emphasis: Execute the process twice to test the different paths and check that you receive the right emails.
